required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Identification of Genomic Predictors of Adverse Events After Cardiac Surgery
clinical_study.official_title: Identification of Genomic Predictors of Adverse Events After Cardiac Surgery

collaborator.agency: National Heart, Lung, and Blood Institute (NHLBI)
University of Texas Southwestern Medical Center

brief_summary.textblock:
This study aims to identify genetic causes of adverse events after cardiac surgery, such as atrial fibrillation, myocardial infarction, renal dysfunction and heart failure.
Patients undergoing heart surgery at Brigham and Women's Hospital and Texas Heart Institute are eligible to participate.

detailed_description.textblock: This study aims to identify genetic causes of adverse events after cardiac surgery, such as atrial fibrillation, myocardial infarction, renal dysfunction and heart failure. In addition, we also examine blood and urine biomarkers (proteins).

primary_outcome.measure: Mortality (i.e. number of participants who are deceased during postoperative day 0 up to year 5)
primary_outcome.description: Data will be collected from electronic medical records; data points to be collected for this measurement include serum creatinine.

other_outcome.measure: Acute Kidney Injury using KDIGO criteria: albumin/creatinine ratio (>/= 300 mg/g) and eGRF (< 60 mL/min/1.73^2)
other_outcome.time_frame: Day of procedure to post procedure day 7
other_outcome.description: Data will be collected from electronic medical records; data points to be collected for this measurement include serum creatinine.

other_outcome.measure: Presence of Arrhythmia (i.e. number of patients who develop an arrhythmia after their cardiac surgery)
other_outcome.description: Data will be collected from electronic medical records; data points to be collected for this measurement include post-procedural EKG reports and progress notes.

other_outcome.measure: Myocardial Infarction (i.e. number of participants who develop a MI during postoperative day 0 to year 5)
other_outcome.description: Data will be collected from electronic medical records; data points to be collected for this measurement include post-procedural EKG reports, cardiac enzyme values, progress notes, and cardiac catheterization reports.

other_outcome.measure: Heart failure per NYHA class II, III, IV
other_outcome.description: This will be measured in accordance to New York Heart Association Guidelines.

other_outcome.measure: Quality of Life Survey - The Kansas City Cardiomyopathy Questionnaire (KCCQShortForm)
other_outcome.time_frame: Administered once prior to the procedure and 1 month to 5 years after hospital discharge
other_outcome.description: A questionnaire to assess for heart failure

other_outcome.measure: Quality of Life Survey - The Seattle Angina Questionnaire (SAQShortForm)
other_outcome.time_frame: Administered once prior to the procedure and 1 month to 5 years after hospital discharge
other_outcome.description: A questionnaire to assess for angina

other_outcome.measure: Quality of Life Survey - 12-item short form health survey (SF12)
other_outcome.time_frame: Administered once prior to the procedure and 1 month to 5 years after hospital discharge
other_outcome.description: A questionnaire to assess for overall health

biospec_descr.textblock: DNA, buffy coat, plasma, serum and urine

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Undergoing heart surgery
- Willing to provide consent
Exclusion Criteria:
- Enrolled in a concurrent drug or device trial that precludes concurrent enrollment

overall_official.last_name: Jochen D Muehlschlegel, MD MMSc, MPH

facility.name: Department Texas Heart Institute at St. Luke's Episcopal Hospital
